Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: i don't speak officially for KMD. All I know, is web wallets are insecure and you should not use one except to test tiny transactions. It's best not to use it at all.

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: Agama in "Light Mode" means you don't have to download lots of stuff, you probably want to use that

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: with web wallets, you are completely trusting all your money to many many third parties. The person who runs your internet, the people who control the domain name, evil hackers that can abuse basics of the internet to steal your money. There is no way to protect against it. Hence, web wallets are inherently insecure

Author: sajjad#4095
Content: Agma is going to download Zcash param keys ?

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: yes. Agama does everything

Author: SHossain#0007
Content:
Here is the web wallet https://www.atomicexplorer.com/wallet
**Use with caution and don't use with a lot of funds**

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: still under development

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @SHossain maybe the front page of that should explain all the Bad Things that can happen 😃

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: @dukeleto there is already a warning

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @SHossain oh, that is nice 😃

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: Stuff like this cannot be stopped, it can happen any time: https://qz.com/1261540/mew-ethereum-hack-the-internets-infrastructure-was-compromised-to-target-myetherwallet/

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: every web wallet of every coin is susceptible to that attack. Which is why I tell newcomers to stay away from web wallets

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: just click on **Understand the risks** and the whole message is displayed there

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: if you get used to a web wallet, you might never use anything else. One day, all your funds are gone

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @SHossain i will go back into my code cave now 😃

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: yeah. i would never use a web wallet

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: pbca26 created this one after some users wanting it

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: if you make a new address via web wallet, that privkey could be compromised, even if you make no transactions via web wallet. Be careful, folks

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @SHossain Hush has a web wallet for the same reason, people would not stop asking for it, even when devs explain how bad of an idea it is to use it for large amounts of funds

Author: sajjad#4095
Content: if I change my PC and install Agma again, can I access my wallet with my `seed` ?

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @sajjad as long as you have your seedphrase, you can bring that to any computer in the world, log into Agama, and see all your funds

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: make sure you trust the computer, tho 😃

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: yes. and seed will only give you access to specific single address all time. if you use native mode, be sure to backup private keys of all addresses

Author: sajjad#4095
Content: how about lite mode, is it secure ?

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: if your computer is secure, then Lite mode is secure too. your private key never leaves your computer.

Author: sajjad#4095
Content: and if I change my computer ?

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: it uses Electrum servers to query data

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: is the other computer secure?

Author: sajjad#4095
Content: yes

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: then, it is same as the other computer

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: if your computer is secure, then Lite mode is secure too.

Author: sajjad#4095
Content: so just with seed I can login and access to my wallet. no matters where I install it

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: yes

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: same goes for Agama for Android and iOS

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: you can use same seed passphrase or WIF key there

Author: sajjad#4095
Content: Thanks alot @SHossain  and @dukeleto

Author: Ogodomiya#2535
Content: Please someone should help me confirm if kmd will be experiencing hard fork this month.

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: There is a network upgrade happening on 15th December. Equivalent to a hardfork. But, there will not be any other chain, only mainchain.

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: for most people, if the term "hard fork" scares you, just replace it with "mandatory upgrade". If you don't upgrade, your node will not be on the correct network

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: you won't lose your money, but it's a headache of fixing stuff, instead of upgrading before, and things going smoothly

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: this is not anything like the BTC/BCH fork or other "contentious forks"

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: when you change the "consensus rules" of a cryptocoin, all nodes must agree on the rules. If not, you get forks. So all KMD nodes must upgrade, so everyone is playing by the latest set of rules

Content: OK
